metadata.title: CVE-2019-7653 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The Debian python-rdflib-tools 4.2.2-1 package for RDFLib 4.2.2 has CLI tools that can load Python modules from the current working directory, allowing code injection, because "python -m" looks in this directory, as demonstrated by rdf2dot. This issue is specific to use of the debian/scripts directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-7653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-rdflib-tools - 4.2.2-2
python3-rdflib - 4.2.2-2
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> python-rdflib-tools binary package is in universe

criterions.comment: rdflib package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.2-2').
